info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 21 at 9:10PM MDT by NWS Pueblo
info.description: ...Thunderstorms will impact portions of central El Paso County through 945 PM MDT... At 908 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking thunderstorms over southeastern Colorado Springs. This storm was nearly stationary. Heavy rainfall is likely with this storm as they intensify. HAZARD...Half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Southeastern Colorado Springs, Fountain, Stratmoor, Schriever AFB, Fort Carson, Security, Peterson AFB, Security-Widefield, Falcon and Cimarron Hills. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1100 PM MDT for east central Colorado.
